summary: This is an email chain from February 2020 regarding the technical processing of materials seized from Jeffrey Epstein. The emails discuss uploading data from an FBI-provided hard drive to a review platform (Relativity) and conducting a privilege review. The correspondence indicates ongoing evidence processing in the Epstein case.

persons.name: PAE
persons.context: Requested to run privilege search terms on uploaded Epstein materials and organize the results into folders.

connections.description: Both are involved in the technical and legal review process for Epstein case materials, with M conducting the privilege review and PAE handling the data processing.

events.title: Receipt of Epstein Hard Drive from FBI
events.description: A hard drive processed by the FBI CART from devices seized in the Epstein case was received for uploading to a review platform.

events.title: Data Upload Expected
events.description: Communication that the data from the Epstein hard drive should be ready for upload by Monday morning.

events.title: Privilege Review Instructions
events.description: Instructions given to run privilege search terms on the uploaded Epstein materials and organize the results, pending a spot check.

keyFacts: The FBI provided a hard drive containing processed data from devices seized in the Jeffrey Epstein investigation.
The materials were to be uploaded to the Relativity platform for a privilege review, a standard legal process to filter out protected attorney-client communications.
The email chain indicates an ongoing, methodical evidence review process in the Epstein case as of early 2020.
A reviewer named 'M' had previously conducted privilege reviews for Epstein search warrant returns, suggesting continuity in the legal team's work.
The correspondence is logistical, focusing on the technical steps of data handling and review rather than the content of the evidence itself.
